revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{confix|en|xyr|alt1=xyro|gloss1=razor-like|philic}} ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # {{lb|en|botany|rare}} Having {{l|en|sharp}}, {{l|en|razor}}-like {{l|en|leaf|leaves}}. #* '''1985''', Reid Badger and Lawrence A. Clayton [eds.], ''Alabama and the Borderlands: From Prehistory to Statehood'' ([[w:University of Alabama Press|University of Alabama Press]]; {{ISBN|0817302085}}, 9780817302085), [http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=E1sTAAAAYAAJ&q=xyrophilic&dq=xyrophilic&hl=en&ei=1XkCTsCdMNSt8QOSp7C3DQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAQ page 22] #*: In Mexico and the American Southwest, lush well-watered plains were slowly replaced by arid lands with a '''xyrophilic''' plant cover.²⁶
